PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 21 The absorption edges for solid films of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO are 703 and 704 nm , respectively , corresponding to nearly the same optical band gap ( E g opt ) of 1.76 eV.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| absorption edges |
| optical band gap (Eg opt) |

The two "Property Name" entities identified in the paragraph are "absorption edges" and "optical band gap (Eg opt)". These entities are mentioned as properties of the solid films of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| absorption edges |
| optical band gap (Eg opt) |

After re-evaluating the paragraph, the two entities identified earlier still refer to material properties. "Absorption edges" refer to the wavelengths at which a material starts to absorb light, while "optical band gap (Eg opt)" refers to the energy difference between the valence band maximum and the conduction band minimum in a material. Therefore, these two entities are still considered as material properties.
